required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Growth Retardation In Children With Special Pathological Conditions Or Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Evolution Of Growth Rate In Children Suffering From A Disease Associated With Growth Retardation and Treated By Genotonorm. A Pilot Study.

brief_summary.textblock: To show an increase in annual growth rate 3 years after Visit 2. Annual growth rate in standard deviation (SD) after 3 years will be compared to growth rate before the start of GH treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Annual Growth Rate Standard Deviation Score (SDS) for Chronological Age (CA) at Month 36 in Intent-to-Treat (ITT) Population
primary_outcome.description: Change in annual growth rate (AGR) standard deviation score (SDS) for chronological age (CA) derived by subtracting AGR SDS CA at baseline from each time point (Yx) value. AGR at Yx= (height Yx-height Y[x-1])/([date of Yx-date of Y{x-1}]/365.25). AGR as SDS calculated using Sempe reference means and standard deviations (SD) for growth rate. AGR SDS CA (for both baseline and Yx)= (AGR-reference mean for growth rate CA)/reference SD for growth rate CA. CA calculated as integer (Date of height measurement-Date of birth)/365.25*12. SDS indicates how similar participant was to reference population.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Annual Growth Rate Standard Deviation Score (SDS) for Chronological Age (CA) at Month 36 in Per-Protocol (PP) Population
primary_outcome.description: Change in annual growth rate (AGR) standard deviation score (SDS) for chronological age (CA) derived by subtracting AGR SDS CA at baseline from each time point (Yx) value. AGR at Yx= (height Yx-height Y[x-1])/([date of Yx-date of Y{x-1}]/365.25). AGR as SDS calculated using Sempe reference means and standard deviations (SD) for growth rate. AGR SDS CA (for both baseline and Yx)= (AGR-reference mean for growth rate CA)/reference SD for growth rate CA. CA calculated as integer (Date of height measurement-Date of birth)/365.25*12. SDS indicates how similar participant was to reference population.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Annual Growth Rate at Month 12, Month 24 and Month 36 in ITT Population
secondary_outcome.description: Change in AGR at Yx was derived by subtracting AGR at baseline from Yx value. Annual growth rate was calculated each year and rescaled to 1 year if the interval between Yx and Y[x-1] was not 365 days, as long as a participant remained in the study. AGR at Yx was calculated using the previous height measurements (Y[x-1]) and height recorded at Yx (AGR Yx = [height Yx-height Y{x-1}] / ([date of Yx - date of Y{x-1}] /365.25).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Annual Growth Rate at Month 12, Month 24, Month 36 in PP Population
secondary_outcome.description: Change in AGR at Yx was derived by subtracting AGR at baseline from Yx value. Annual growth rate was calculated each year and rescaled to 1 year if the interval between Yx and Y[x-1] was not 365 days, as long as a participant remained in the study. AGR at Yx was calculated using the previous height measurements (Y[x-1]) and height recorded at Yx (AGR Yx = [height Yx-height Y{x-1}] / ([date of Yx - date of Y{x-1}] /365.25).
Height was measured using a wall mounted device (example, Harpenden stadiometer). The standing height of the participant was measured two times and the mean of these measurements was recorded.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Height at Month 12, Month 24 and Month 36
secondary_outcome.description: Height was measured using a wall mounted device (example, Harpenden stadiometer). The standing height of the participant was measured two times and the mean of these measurements was recorded.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Height Standard Deviation Score (SDS) for Chronological Age (CA)
secondary_outcome.description: Height was measured using a wall mounted device (example, Harpenden stadiometer). The standing height of the participant was measured two times and the mean of these measurements was recorded. Height SDS CA Yx = (height Yx - reference mean for CA Yx) / reference SD for CA Yx. Height in SDS was calculated using Sempe reference means and SD for height. CA calculated as integer (Date of height measurement-Date of birth)/365.25*12. SDS indicates how similar the participant was to the reference population.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Height Standard Deviation Score (SDS) for Chronological Age (CA) at Month 12, Month 24 and Month 36
secondary_outcome.description: Change in height SDS CA was derived by subtracting height SDS CA at baseline from Yx value. Height SDS CA (for both baseline and Yx) = (height - reference mean for CA)/reference SD for CA. Height in SDS was calculated using Sempe reference means and SD for height. CA calculated as integer (Date of height measurement - Date of birth)/365.25*12. SDS indicates how similar the participant was to the reference population.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Height Standard Deviation Score (SDS) for Bone Age (BA)
secondary_outcome.description: Height SDS BA Yx = (height Yx - reference mean for BA Yx) / reference SD for BA Yx. Height in SDS was calculated using Sempe reference means and SD for height. BA was estimated locally using an X-ray from the left wrist and hand. SDS indicates how similar the participant was to the reference population.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Height Standard Deviation Score (SDS) for Bone Age (BA) at Month 12, Month 24 and Month 36
secondary_outcome.description: Change in height SDS BA was derived by subtracting height SDS BA at baseline from Yx value. Height SDS BA (for both baseline and Yx) = (height-reference mean for BA)/reference SD for BA. Height in SDS was calculated using Sempe reference means and SD for height. BA was estimated locally using an X-ray from the left wrist and hand. SDS indicates how similar the participant was to the reference population.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Annual Growth Rate Standard Deviation Score (SDS) for Chronological Age (CA) at Month 12 and Month 24 in ITT Population
secondary_outcome.description: Change in AGR SDS for CA derived by subtracting AGR SDS CA at baseline from Yx value. AGR at Yx= (height Yx-height Y[x-1])/([date of Yx-date of Y{x-1}]/365.25). AGR as SDS calculated using Sempe reference means and standard deviations (SD) for growth rate. AGR SDS CA (for both baseline and Yx)= (AGR-reference mean for growth rate CA)/reference SD for growth rate CA. CA calculated as integer (Date of height measurement-Date of birth)/365.25*12. SDS indicates how similar participant was to reference population.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Annual Growth Rate Standard Deviation Score (SDS) for Chronological Age (CA) at Month 12 and Month 24 in PP Population
secondary_outcome.description: Change in annual growth rate (AGR) standard deviation score (SDS) for chronological age (CA) derived by subtracting AGR SDS CA at baseline from each time point (Yx) value. AGR at Yx= (height Yx-height Y[x-1])/([date of Yx-date of Y{x-1}]/365.25). AGR as SDS calculated using Sempe reference means and standard deviations (SD) for growth rate. AGR SDS CA (for both baseline and Yx)= (AGR-reference mean for growth rate CA)/reference SD for growth rate CA. CA calculated as integer (Date of height measurement-Date of birth)/365.25*12. SDS indicates how similar participant was to reference population.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Growth Rate Standard Deviation Score (SDS) for Bone Age (BA)
secondary_outcome.description: AGR at Yx was derived by subtracting AGR at baseline from Yx value. AGR was calculated each year and rescaled to 1 year if the interval between Yx and Y[x-1] was not 365 days, as long as a participant remained in the study. AGR at Yx = [height Yx-height Y{x-1}] / ([date of Yx - date of Y{x-1}] /365.25). GR in SDS was calculated using Sempe reference means and SD for growth. BA was estimated locally using an X-ray from the left wrist and hand. SDS indicates how similar the participant was to the reference population.
BMI was used to measure body fat based on height and weight. It was calculated as body weight (kilogram) divided by the height (meter) squared.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Body Mass Index (BMI) at Month 12, Month 24 and Month 36
secondary_outcome.description: BMI was used to measure body fat based on height and weight. It was calculated as body weight (kilogram) divided by the height (meter) squared.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Bone Age (BA) at Month 12, Month 24 and Month 36
secondary_outcome.description: BA was estimated locally using an X-ray from the left wrist and hand.

secondary_outcome.measure: Ratio of Bone Age (BA) to Chronological Age (CA)
secondary_outcome.description: BA was estimated locally using an X-ray from the left wrist and hand. CA at the date of corresponding X-ray (Date of X-ray - Date of birth)/365.25. Ratio of BA/CA at each annual study visit was calculated.

intervention.description: Adapted dosage based on IGF 1 level and weight Form: liquid; Dosage and Frequency: from 0.0033mg/kg/day to 0.0067 mg/kg/day; Duration: 3 years

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Bone age < 13 years for a boy and < 11 years for a girl
- Naive child: Measured Height < -2.5 SD for CA
- Child currently treated by GH
Exclusion Criteria:
- Idiopathic short stature
- Syndrome known to be associated with an increased risk of cancer e.g. family history of adenomatous polyposis

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

group.title: Genotonorm
group.description: Genotonorm (recombinant somatropin) up to maximum of 50 microgram/kilogram/day (mcg/kg/day) subcutaneously as decided by the investigator, divided in 7 daily doses for up to 3 years.

group.title: Genotonorm
group.description: Genotonorm (recombinant somatropin) up to maximum of 50 microgram/kilogram/day (mcg/kg/day) subcutaneously as decided by the investigator, divided in 7 daily doses for up to 3 years.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Annual Growth Rate Standard Deviation Score (SDS) for Chronological Age (CA) at Month 36 in Intent-to-Treat (ITT) Population
outcome.description: Change in annual growth rate (AGR) standard deviation score (SDS) for chronological age (CA) derived by subtracting AGR SDS CA at baseline from each time point (Yx) value. AGR at Yx= (height Yx–height Y[x-1])/([date of Yx–date of Y{x-1}]/365.25). AGR as SDS calculated using Sempe reference means and standard deviations (SD) for growth rate. AGR SDS CA (for both baseline and Yx)= (AGR-reference mean for growth rate CA)/reference SD for growth rate CA. CA calculated as integer (Date of height measurement-Date of birth)/365.25*12. SDS indicates how similar participant was to reference population.
outcome.population: Intent to Treat (ITT) set included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication and had at least 1 evaluation of height after start of study medication. Here ‘N’ (Number of participants analyzed) signifies those participants who were evaluable for this measure and “n” signifies participants evaluated at that time point.

outcome.population: Per Protocol (PP) analysis set included all participants in the ITT set without a major protocol violation. Here ‘N’ (Number of participants analyzed) signifies those participants who were evaluable for this measure and “n” signifies participants evaluated at that time point.

outcome.description: Change in annual growth rate (AGR) standard deviation score (SDS) for chronological age (CA) derived by subtracting AGR SDS CA at baseline from each time point (Yx) value. AGR at Yx= (height Yx–height Y[x-1])/([date of Yx–date of Y{x-1}]/365.25). AGR as SDS calculated using Sempe reference means and standard deviations (SD) for growth rate. AGR SDS CA (for both baseline and Yx)= (AGR-reference mean for growth rate CA)/reference SD for growth rate CA. CA calculated as integer (Date of height measurement-Date of birth)/365.25*12. SDS indicates how similar participant was to reference population.
outcome.population: PP analysis set included all participants in the ITT set without a major protocol violation. Here ‘N’ (Number of participants analyzed) signifies those participants who were evaluable for this measure.

group.title: Genotonorm
group.description: Genotonorm (recombinant somatropin) up to maximum of 50 microgram/kilogram/day (mcg/kg/day) subcutaneously as decided by the investigator, divided in 7 daily doses for up to 3 years.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Annual Growth Rate Standard Deviation Score (SDS) for Chronological Age (CA) at Month 12 and Month 24 in PP Population
measure.description: Change in annual growth rate (AGR) standard deviation score (SDS) for chronological age (CA) derived by subtracting AGR SDS CA at baseline from each time point (Yx) value. AGR at Yx= (height Yx–height Y[x-1])/([date of Yx–date of Y{x-1}]/365.25). AGR as SDS calculated using Sempe reference means and standard deviations (SD) for growth rate. AGR SDS CA (for both baseline and Yx)= (AGR-reference mean for growth rate CA)/reference SD for growth rate CA. CA calculated as integer (Date of height measurement-Date of birth)/365.25*12. SDS indicates how similar participant was to reference population.
measure.population: PP analysis set included all participants in the ITT set without a major protocol violation. Here ‘N’ (Number of participants analyzed) signifies those participants who were evaluable for this measure.

outcome.title: Mean Growth Rate Standard Deviation Score (SDS) for Bone Age (BA)
outcome.description: AGR at Yx was derived by subtracting AGR at baseline from Yx value. AGR was calculated each year and rescaled to 1 year if the interval between Yx and Y[x-1] was not 365 days, as long as a participant remained in the study. AGR at Yx = [height Yx–height Y{x-1}] / ([date of Yx – date of Y{x-1}] /365.25). GR in SDS was calculated using Sempe reference means and SD for growth. BA was estimated locally using an X-ray from the left wrist and hand. SDS indicates how similar the participant was to the reference population.
outcome.population: ITT set included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication and had at least 1 evaluation of height after start of study medication. Here ‘N’ (Number of participants analyzed) signifies those participants who were evaluable for this measure and “n” signifies participants evaluated at that time point.

group.title: Genotonorm
group.description: Genotonorm (recombinant somatropin) up to maximum of 50 microgram/kilogram/day (mcg/kg/day) subcutaneously as decided by the investigator, divided in 7 daily doses for up to 3 years.

measure.title: Mean Growth Rate Standard Deviation Score (SDS) for Bone Age (BA)
measure.description: AGR at Yx was derived by subtracting AGR at baseline from Yx value. AGR was calculated each year and rescaled to 1 year if the interval between Yx and Y[x-1] was not 365 days, as long as a participant remained in the study. AGR at Yx = [height Yx–height Y{x-1}] / ([date of Yx – date of Y{x-1}] /365.25). GR in SDS was calculated using Sempe reference means and SD for growth. BA was estimated locally using an X-ray from the left wrist and hand. SDS indicates how similar the participant was to the reference population.
measure.population: ITT set included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication and had at least 1 evaluation of height after start of study medication. Here ‘N’ (Number of participants analyzed) signifies those participants who were evaluable for this measure and “n” signifies participants evaluated at that time point.

outcome.title: Body Mass Index (BMI)
outcome.description: BMI was used to measure body fat based on height and weight. It was calculated as body weight (kilogram) divided by the height (meter) squared.
outcome.population: ITT set included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication and had at least 1 evaluation of height after start of study medication. Here “n” signifies those participants evaluated at that time point.

outcome.title: Ratio of Bone Age (BA) to Chronological Age (CA)
outcome.description: BA was estimated locally using an X-ray from the left wrist and hand. CA at the date of corresponding X-ray (Date of X-ray – Date of birth)/365.25. Ratio of BA/CA at each annual study visit was calculated.
outcome.population: ITT set included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication and had at least 1 evaluation of height after start of study medication. Here ‘N’ (Number of participants analyzed) signifies those participants who were evaluable for this measure and “n” signifies those participants evaluated at that time point.

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: Genotonorm
group.description: Genotonorm (recombinant somatropin) up to maximum of 50 microgram/kilogram/day (mcg/kg/day) subcutaneously as decided by the investigator, divided in 7 daily doses for up to 3 years.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)
Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
